abstracts.cdata!:
The Mexico housing and urban poverty
            reduction program continues to be robust with strong
            ownership from the Government of Mexico. The number of
            housing subsidies continues to increase while being better
            targeted to the poor and (for the first time in Mexico)
            incentivizing the used housing market. The housing
            microfinance pilot has made steady progress and the number
            of microfinance loans is increasing. The number of plots
            allocated to beneficiaries of the program Habitat for
            low-income housing also has increased. The Third Affordable
            Housing and Urban Poverty Reduction Development Policy Loan
            (HUDPL III) will support a number of the new
            administration's priorities and initiatives in the
            housing and construction sector. It consolidates and deepens
            the reforms undertaken under the first and second loans,
            HUSAL-I and HUDPL-II, which were approved in April 2004 and
            November 2005, respectively.
